critique: The document establishes the National Advisory Council on International Monetary and Financial Policies and delegates certain functions to the Council and the Secretary of the Treasury. It focuses on coordinating international financial policies and ensuring information flow between government agencies and international financial organizations. There is no mention of immigration. The document does not explicitly expand executive power but delegates authority to the Secretary of Treasury. The document does not explicitly promote federal control but establishes a council. The document does not explicitly focus on security or liberty. The document does not explicitly promote deregulation or intervention, but focuses on international monetary and financial policies. The document does not explicitly promote social inclusion or conformity.
